author: Evelyn Blackwell
title: Hurricane Milton: Baby Born During Massive Storm Is A 'miracle', Says Mother - WorldNewsEra
text: A woman has given birth to a "miracle baby" during Hurricane Milton after making a perilous journey to hospital while in labour.Kenzie Lewellen, who was 39 weeks pregnant, witnessed the devastation from her hospital window, with a tree being ripped out of the ground as the massive storm pounded Florida earlier this week. She also needed a caesarean section as the baby boy was in the wrong position. "I was very scared," the first-time mother said.Follow live: Man saved clinging to cool boxMilton made landfall as a Category 3 storm at about 8.30pm local time on Wednesday (1.30am UK time on Thursday), causing massive flooding and leaving millions of people without power. At least 16 people have been confirmed dead in Florida in the hurricane's aftermath, including at least five due to tornadoes in St Lucie County.Ms Lewellen's labour began at home in Port Charlotte at 4am on Wednesday, Sky's US partner network NBC News reports.At that time, the storm had not yet hit the state but Ms Lewellen and her boyfriend Dewey Bennett's house already started taking in water before her contractions began."My mind was just running a million miles an hour, like, what am I going to do?" the 22-year-old woman said. "I was very nervous." Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player 0:50 Florida before and after Hurricane Milton Then, after she had been in labour for more than four hours at home, the couple started making their way to Sarasota Memorial Hospital in Venice."My mom was driving us, and it was extremely windy, so we were trying to be as cautious as possible," Ms Lewellen said."There was not really many people on the roads, because it was so windy outside and it was raining quite a bit." Image: Dewey Bennett with his son Dewey Lester Bennett IV. Pic: Kenzie Lewellen The couple were even more on edge during the medical emergency as Mr Bennett's father, also named Dewey, had died when Hurricane Irma slammed into Florida in 2017."My dad had a massive heart attack because the ambulance could not come out to us during the storm," the 24-year-old said."I just didn't want to go through what I had to go through with the last hurricane back in 2017," added Mr Bennett.Watching a tree uproot during labourWhen the trio arrived at hospital, only one person could be with her. So, Ms Lewellen had to say goodbye to her mother."I was very, very upset that my mom couldn't stay, because she is my best friend and one of my biggest supporters," she said. But "we were able to FaceTime pretty much the entire time". Image: Kenzie Lewellen and Dewey Bennett. Pic: Kenzie Lewellen She then went through labour in a room with a window view of the destruction as the storm struck the area."I was telling him [Mr Bennett], I'm like, 'Oh, that tree looks like it's going to fly out of the ground!' when I was labouring, because we were just watching the storm and the wind and the rain go crazy. It was definitely intense out there," she said."And it actually did uproot," added, Mr Bennett, the baby's father. Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player 3:48 Florida escapes worst of hurricane Unplanned C-sectionAfter being in labour for hours, Ms Lewellen was given some distressing news. The baby was in the wrong position, and she would need an unplanned C-section."I had so much going through my head at that point, a storm and my family," she said.Problems with the epidural left her in extreme pain for hours until she was given anaesthesia. Follow Sky News on WhatsApp Keep up with all the latest news from the UK and around the world by following Sky News Tap here "I was just on my own, by myself, and I was very scared. If I didn't have the doctors and the nurses that I had, it would have been a whole lot worse," she said.Read more:After Hurricane Milton the storm of US politics is just getting goingWill there be more Atlantic hurricanes in 2024?Dewey Lester Bennett IV was safely delivered at 11.45pm, weighing 8lbs."He is a miracle baby," Ms Lewellen said.In a statement, the chief executive of Sarasota Memorial Health Care System David Verinder said: "We couldn't be prouder of our team. They left their homes and many left their families to be here for our patients and community."Along with Dewey, six other babies were born at the two Sarasota Memorial hospitals during Milton, Mr Verinder said. Checkout latest world news below links : World News || Latest News || U.S. News Source link

author: Jorge Villanes
title: Esta madre soltera fue criticada duramente por tener 12 hijos: así respondió
text: Veronica Merritt, una madre soltera de 12 hijos que reside en Nueva York, se ha visto en la necesidad de depender de cupones de descuento debido al aumento del costo de vida. Mediante sus redes sociales, reveló que la cifra que paga para alimentar a su familia alcanzó los 24 mil dólares al año, lo que la ha llevado a recurrir a una dieta limitada, centrada en macarrones, hot dogs y paquetes de ramen. A pesar de enfrentar críticas en TikTok por su situación financiera, la mujer defendió su elección de tener una familia grande y expresa que cada hijo es un tesoro para ella, a pesar de los desafíos económicos que enfrenta a diario. A lo largo de los años, la madre ha utilizado cupones de alimentos de manera intermitente, recibiendo asistencia del gobierno mediante un cheque de 1400 dólares cada mes: sin embargo, señala que esta ayuda no es suficiente para cubrir los crecientes costos de los alimentos. Tiempo atrás, Veroniac podía alimentar a su familia por tan solo 500 dólares al mes, pero ahora necesita entre 2 mil y 3 mil dólares para proporcionar una alimentación adecuada, lo que refleja el impacto de la inflación en los presupuestos familiares. “Vivimos de ramen cuando antes podíamos comprar cualquier cosa. Solía poder ir al supermercado y comprar lo que queríamos y no tener que preocuparme por eso”, señaló. A pesar de los desafíos financieros, la mujer no lamenta haber tenido tantos hijos y describe el tener bebés como su “superpoder”. “No pienso en los niños como accidentes. Son mis pequeñas sorpresas”, aseguró. Tuvo sus primeros 10 hijos con su primer esposo, antes de casarse con el segundo y tener dos más. Sus hijos son: Victoria, 24, Andrew, 19, Adam, 17, Mara, 16, Dash, 14, Darla, 13, Marvelous, 11, Martalya, 9, Amelia, 7, Delilah, 10, Donovan, 4, y Modi, 2. Quería tener más hijos, pero no pudo “Nunca habría tenido hijos si hubiera esperado hasta ser rica; no me arrepiento de ninguno de ellos”, afirmó Veronica, quien de hecho quería seguir dando a luz, pero se vio obligada a someterse a una histerectomía debido a un fibroma. “Seis niños y seis niñas es bastante perfecto, especialmente porque tengo un niño y una niña para cada color”, añadió. “Es curiosamente perfecto lo bien que funcionó. Si quisiera tener más, tendría que ser rico y contratar una madre sustituta”. Por otra parte, se animó a hablar de su activa vida sexual, la cual comenzó cuando era bastante joven: “Tenía 14 años cuando tuve el primero, era muy joven y no entendía realmente cómo funcionaba la reproducción. Pensé que tenías que tener 16 años para quedar embarazada. Pensé: ‘No me sucederá a mí', pero pasó casi tan pronto como comencé a ser sexualmente activa”. La situación financiera de Verónica se ve agravada por los gastos en épocas festividades y las necesidades del hogar. La Navidad sola puede costarle hasta 7 mil dólares, mientras que mantener su casa de nueve habitaciones requiere reparaciones costosas que actualmente están fuera de su alcance. No obstante, la mujer está decidida a encontrar soluciones, incluida la generación de ingresos a través de su presencia en TikTok y la venta de pinturas. Aunque enfrenta críticas y ataques en las redes, Veronica mantiene una actitud positiva y señala que “ojalá hubiera elegido mejores parejas para no ser madre soltera en este momento, pero me encanta tener bebés. Creo que tener un bebé es la cosa más grande, preciosa y maravillosa que jamás haya existido”. Gracias por visitarnos hoy. Espero que este contenido de video viral haya sido de tu agrado. Si deseas encontrar más contenido similar, visítanos en [Mag.elcomercio.pe](https://mag.elcomercio.pe/). Te estaremos esperando. Más historias [Joven logra ahorrar casi $8 mil en un año dejando de gastar en estas 4 cosas](https://mag.elcomercio.pe/usa/tendencias-us/video-viral-joven-ahorra-8-mil-en-un-ano-dejando-de-gastar-en-estas-4-cosas-eeuu-nnda-nnrt-noticia/) [La inquietante experiencia de una mujer que se hospedó en un hotel de California](https://mag.elcomercio.pe/historias/video-viral-la-experiencia-de-mujer-que-se-hospedo-en-hotel-de-california-nnda-nnrt-noticia/) [Trabajó varios años en un conocido fast food, pero ahora es millonario: “no fue difícil”](https://mag.elcomercio.pe/historias/inglaterra-trabajo-varios-anos-en-un-conocido-fast-food-ahora-es-millonario-historias-nnda-nnrt-noticia/) Las consecuencias económicas de tener una familia numerosa Tener una familia numerosa implica asumir responsabilidades económicas significativas, pero también ofrece grandes satisfacciones y oportunidades de crecimiento. La clave está en una planificación financiera adecuada, aprovechar los beneficios disponibles y, sobre todo, en el amor, la dedicación y el trabajo en equipo de todos los miembros de la familia. author: Sakchi Khandelwal
title: Heroic Rescue in Winchester: Deputies Save Three from Tree-Crushed Trailer Amidst Live Wires
text:
On a seemingly ordinary morning in Winchester, Idaho, an emergency call at 8:15 a.m. transformed into a tale of swift action and community heroism. Lewis County deputies, alongside local emergency responders, orchestrated the safe evacuation of three individuals from a dire situation, where a massive tree had not only crushed their trailer but also brought down live power lines, creating a perilous blockade at 216 Nezperce Avenue.
Timely Response and Teamwork
Upon receiving the distress call, the Lewis County Sheriff's Office and the Winchester Fire Department, supplemented by the Winchester Quick Response unit, rushed to the scene. Their prompt arrival was critical. The tree, in its fall, had ensnared the trailer's occupants in a precarious position, with the added danger of electrified debris due to the compromised power lines. Despite these hazards, deputies made the brave decision to enter the unstable trailer, ensuring that the occupants were unharmed while awaiting a safer exit strategy.
Strategic Operation and Evacuation
The operation took a turn for the better with the arrival of Avista utilities, whose technicians managed to de-energize the surrounding power lines. This crucial step allowed rescue teams to carve a path through the debris, safely reaching and evacuating the trapped individuals. The successful rescue underscored the importance of coordination and expertise amongst the different emergency response teams. Remarkably, throughout this harrowing ordeal, the occupants remained uninjured, a testament to the resilience of the human spirit and the protective measures taken by the responders.
Community Support and Reflection
In the aftermath of the rescue, the community rallied to provide support for the affected individuals, with the American Red Cross stepping in to offer necessary assistance. This incident, while highlighting the unpredictability of life, also showcased the strength of a community when faced with unexpected challenges. It serves as a powerful reminder of the bravery and dedication of emergency responders who put their lives on the line to ensure the safety of others.
As Winchester reflects on this close call, the incident sparks a broader conversation on preparedness and community resilience in the face of natural disasters. While the physical scars may heal, the memory of this day will linger, inspiring ongoing discussions about safety, emergency response, and the indomitable spirit of community solidarity.

author: Times of Oman
title: RNO receives a new batch of citizens
text:
Muscat: The Royal Navy of Oman, in coordination with the Ministry of Labour, received on Monday a new batch of citizens who began military training after they passed the stages of acceptance, evaluation, tests, and medical and physical examinations.
This comes as a continuation of the national efforts of the Sultan’s Armed Forces to absorb national competencies who meet the recruitment requirements. They will join the military training programme and be nominated as officers in the Royal Navy of Oman.
The Royal Navy of Oman has harnessed all its expertise and capabilities in terms of specialised manpower and administrative and health requirements, in order to provide an appropriate environment to achieve the speedy implementation of procedures for joining military service and fields of national duty.
These efforts are undertaken by the Sultan’s Armed Forces to accommodate the people of the nation in accordance with plans and programmes established to recruit national competencies into the Sultan’s Armed Forces and other departments of the Ministry of Defence. -ONA
